page.title: 01A SUMMARY OF LYVEDEN
page.content: Lyveden is a small area in rural Northamptonshire. There are not many amenities in Lyveden, apart from a historical site called the 'Lyveden New Bield', built by Sir Thomas Tresham.The Bield is cruciform shape and is meant to show the passion of Jesus,as Sir Thomas was very religious and was persecuted for his Roman Catholic beliefs. The area around Lyveden is mainly farmland with non_grass arable crops. There are only six inhabited buildings in the area, and most of the area is owned by the Duke of Gloucester, including Lyveden Manor which is at the moment rented by tenants. There are different types of deer in the local woods, and various other types of wildlife. Even though there is a lack of activities in Lyveden,it is a very pleasant and enjoyable area.
